edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.digitalSignature

Class OpenSSLRSAPss

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.digitalSignature.RSAPssAbs
      • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.digitalSignature.OpenSSLRSAPss
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DigitalSignature, RSABasedSignature, MacSignSecLevel, OneTime, SecurityLevel, UnlimitedTimes

    public class OpenSSLRSAPss
extends RSAPssAbs
    This class implements the RSA PSS signature scheme, using OpenSSL RSAPss implementation. The RSA PSS (Probabilistic Signature Scheme) is a provably secure way of creating signatures with RSA.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      Constructor that receives random number generation algorithm to use.

    • Method Detail

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
          java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Sets this RSA PSS scheme with public key and private key.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be an instance of RSAPublicKey.
        privateKey - should be an instance of RSAPrivateKey.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given keys are not instances of RSA keys.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Sets this RSA PSS with a public key.

        In this case the signature object can be used only for verification.

        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be an instance of RSAPublicKey.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key is not an instance of RSAPublicKey.

      • sign

        public Signature sign(byte[] msg,
             int offset,
             int length)
               throws java.security.KeyException
        Signs the given message using the native signature object.
        Parameters:
        msg - the byte array to verify the signature with.
        offset - the place in the msg to take the bytes from.
        length - the length of the msg.
        Returns:
        the output signature from the signing.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyException - if PrivateKey is not set.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given offset and length are wrong for the given message.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(Signature signature,
             byte[] msg,
             int offset,
             int length)
        Verifies the given signature using the native object.
        Parameters:
        signature - to verify should be an instance of RSASignature.
        msg - the byte array to verify the signature with
        offset - the place in the msg to take the bytes from
        length - the length of the msg
        Returns:
        true if the signature is valid. false, otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Signature is not an instance of RSASignature.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given offset and length are wrong for the given message.
